result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody M Ludwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Vehicle for Puproses of Delivery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to consist of full time.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with William E. or Magen O.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court orders an additional 60 days jail with Huber at agent's discretion.
